array.string: 1. Remember that affirmations should focus on the process rather than a desired outcome. “I am learning to x” rather than “I master x”.
2. A classic positive affirmation you may consider adding is: “Every day in every way I am getting stronger”.
3. You can use an affirmation to overcome negative emotions or forgive yourself for mistakes of the past.
4. You can use affirmations to remind yourself to keep a positive attitude, such as: “Today I will be positive and friendly” or “Life is fun”.
5. You can use affirmations to remind yourself to work on adopting new positive habits.
6. An affirmation can be one powerful word, such as “focus”, “work” or “grow”. Use the format which works best for you.
7. Be creative. Try different types of affirmations to find what works best for you.
8. Change the wording of your affirmations slightly from time to time to keep it fresh.
